edu.cmu.sphinx.linguist.dictionary

Class TextDictionary

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cmu.sphinx.linguist.dictionary.TextDictionary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dictionary, Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MappingDictionary, TrainerDictionary

    public class TextDictionary
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dictionary
    Creates a dictionary by quickly reading in an ASCII-based Sphinx-3 format dictionary. When loaded the dictionary just loads each line of the dictionary into the hash table, assuming that most words are not going to be used. Only when a word is actually used is its pronunciations massaged into an array of pronunciations.

    The format of the ASCII dictionary is the word, followed by spaces or tab, followed by the pronunciation(s). For example, a digits dictionary will look like: 

      ONE HH W AH N
  ONE(2) W AH N
  TWO T UW
  THREE TH R IY
  FOUR F AO R
  FIVE F AY V
  SIX S IH K S
  SEVEN S EH V AH N
  EIGHT EY T
  NINE N AY N
  ZERO Z IH R OW
  ZERO(2) Z IY R OW
  OH OW
    In the above example, the words "one" and "zero" have two pronunciations each.

      • loadDictionary

        protected void loadDictionary(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                  boolean isFillerDict)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the given simple dictionary from the given InputStream. The InputStream is assumed to contain ASCII data.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the InputStream of the dictionary
        isFillerDict - true if this is a filler dictionary, false otherwise
        Throws:
